author: Anonym
title: [HIGHLIGHTS] Christ found in those who are demeaned by arrogance - Pope - Vatican
text:
Christ found in those who are demeaned by arrogance - Pope - Vatican. Pope Francis: Christ is to be found in all those stripped of their dignity.
Good Friday liturgy at the Colosseum in Rome on Friday evening. Pope also reflects on the "women of Jerusalem", who "have a voice, yet they make their presence felt" "Help us to recognize the dignity of those women who remained faithful and stood by you in your passion," says Pope Francis in meditations for Via Crucis.

The children who no longer smile due to the "madness of war", the "discarded" women who suffer outrage and violence, and those "Christs humiliated by arrogance and injustice, by unfair gains made at the expense of others in indifference" "Suffering with God does not have the last word", assures the Pontiff in the prayer which, starting from the suffering of Christ on the road to Calvary, embraces all humanity....
Easter week: Pope washes the feet of 12 women in a Rome prison Pope Francis washed the feet of 12 women detained in a Rome prison on Thursday, a rite marking Holy Thursday which precedes Easter. The Argentine Jesuit went in the middle of the afternoon to the women's prison of Rebibbia, on the northeastern outskirts of the Italian capital...

author: Las Dos Orillas
title: Este es el postre verde y nutritivo que puede hacerle a sus perros; le saldrÃ¡ muy barato
text:
Los perros son de los mejores compaÃ±eros que puede tener una persona, su cariÃ±o, lealtad, ternura y hasta amistad. Sin embargo y para pesar de muchos sus aÃ±os de existencia son cortos, por eso es fundamental brindarles una buena calidad de vida para que su paso por este mundo no solo sea bueno y puedan estar mucho mÃ¡s tiempo. AquÃ­ le enseÃ±amos como hacer un postre para perros saludable y lleno de nutrientes.
La alimentaciÃ³n es uno de los pilares fundamentales para que estos animales tengan una vida larga y saludable. Ya no es suficiente darles su comida diaria, si no que debe acompaÃ±arla de suplementos y ayudas que lo nutran aÃºn mÃ¡s y le ayuden a fortalecer tambiÃ©n su sistema inmunolÃ³gico. Es por eso que la veterinaria y creadora de contenido â€˜sandrasierra.tuvetâ€™ dio la receta de un postre que cumple este cometido.
Postre para perros Se trata de un manjar verde nutracÃ©utico, contiene espirulina, un superalimento cargado de nutrientes como proteÃ­na, clorofila y es demasiado beneficioso para sus perros y gatos. TambiÃ©n va a necesitar dos peras, un kiwi, vinagre de manzana y gelatina sin sabor.
Lo primero que debe hacer es triturar las peras para volverlas papilla, luego mezcle un sobre de gelatina sin sabor en una taza. Luego unifica todo los ingredientes en una taza, luego le pone dos cucharadas de espirulina y una cucharada de vinagre de manzana. DespuÃ©s mezcla todo muy bien y lo pone en algunos recipientes en la nevera con los trocitos de kiwi y lo mete a la never hasta que sea una gelatina.
Ver esta publicaciÃ³n en Instagram Una publicaciÃ³n compartida por Sandra Sierra (@sandrasierra.tuvet)
| Ver tambiÃ©n: La lechuga y sus beneficios para los perros; una veterinaria la recomienda

author: Roberta Souza
title: Pix by proximity goes live this Friday and now we can say goodbye to the QR Code! See how it works and who can use the new tool
text:
New highly anticipated feature allows payments without opening the bank's app! Check out how contactless Pix will work
From next time on Friday (28), Brazilians will be able to use the Pix by approximation, making payments even faster and more practical! Now it will be possible make transfers just by touching your cell phone to the machine, as already happens with credit and debit cards, according to the CNN website.
The new eliminates the need to access the bank application to carry out the transaction, making the process more agile and efficient.
How does contactless pix work?
âœ”ï¸ The user must add Pix to the mobile phone's digital wallet (Google Pay, Apple Pay, Samsung Pay, among others).
âœ”ï¸ At the time of payment, simply bring the cell phone closer to the machine, review the transaction details and confirm.
âœ”ï¸ The maximum value allowed will be R$ 500 per operation, but the user can set smaller or daily limits.
âœ”ï¸ Banks, digital wallets and machines are not required to offer the functionality, so it is important to check with your financial institution.
Will traditional pix end?
No! O Pix by proximity is just one extra option. Traditional forms of payment via Pix key and QR Code will continue to exist normally.
ðŸ”¹ At first, the function will be available just for Android devices and users of banks participating in the Open Finance.
ðŸ”¹ The project began testing in October 2023 in some stores Brasilia and Sao Paulo. Now, the functionality is beginning to be expanded throughout Brazil.
Advantages of contactless pix
âœ… faster: You don't need to open the bank app.
âœ… More practicality: It works like a contactless card.
âœ… More safety: Transaction protected by mobile authentication.
???? Check with your bank and enable this new feature to make your payments easier! ðŸ’³ðŸ“²

author: @Region8News
title: Retired police sergeant on vacation with family rescues couple from sinking car
text: Retired police sergeant on vacation with family rescues couple from sinking car CINCINNATI ( [WXIX](https://www.fox19.com/2024/06/21/retired-cpd-sergeant-family-rescue-unknown-tri-state-couple-during-florida-vacation/)/Gray News) - A retired Cincinnati police sergeant and his family saved an Ohio couple who just happened to be vacationing in the same area in Florida. The Ramsey family is from Ohio, while the Bell family lives in northern Kentucky. Up until June 11, the two families had no idea they lived so close to one another. Some might call it a coincidence. Others will say itâ€™s luck, but these two families call it a miracle. Dean and Shana Ramsey recall the moment they said they almost drowned while vacationing in Siesta Key, Florida. Several streets flooded that day after the area received more than 11 inches of rain, an abnormal amount, according to Sarasota County officials. â€œYou couldnâ€™t see anything but rain and water,â€ Dean Ramsey recalled. With several cars stalled on the road, the couple said they tried to pull off on what they thought was land. â€œThe water sucked us right into that lagoon and that was it,â€ Dean Ramsey explained. Watching in horror from their condo was retired Cincinnati Police Department sergeant Mike Bell, his wife Ginger Bell and their three young kids. The Bell family responded. â€œWe were able to stop, slow things down, and assess and make some decisions on how we were going to move forward,â€ Mike Bell said. That plan started with Mackenzie Bell giving valuable information to 911. â€œI remembered they needed to know the address, so thatâ€™s the first thing I told her and then I told her a car is in the pond and there was two people in there,â€ Mikeâ€™s and Ginger Bellâ€™s daughter, Mackenzie Bell, said. Meanwhile, the retired sergeant and his wife, who is an emergency medical doctor, took action. â€œI went over to the edge of the water and realized it wasnâ€™t sinking immediately, so I have a few minutes,â€ Mike Bell recounted from that moment. â€œAt that time, Ginger exited the front door next to the pond. I look at her and said, â€˜We need flotation devices.â€™â€ Thatâ€™s where little Hank Bell came in. â€œI didnâ€™t want them to die, so I ran as fast as I could,â€ Hank Bell explained. â€œI went up the elevator, which is extremely slow, and I knew there were stairs that were faster. So, I ran down the stairs.â€ Flotation devices in hand, the Bell kids handed them to their parents who were already in the water. â€œHe went into the ladyâ€™s side and I went into the manâ€™s side,â€ Ginger Bell said. â€œShe was able to climb out on her own, but I put the boogie board right in front of her. She got her body on the boogie board and thatâ€™s when I started paddling and we kicked over to the side.â€ Ginger Bell ran into some issues helping Dean Ramsey. â€œWhen he was trying to get out, his foot got stuck, so he was on his back with one foot out and one foot stuck in the steering wheel,â€ Ginger Bell remembered. â€œI looked at her and I said, â€˜Iâ€™m stuck, I canâ€™t,â€™â€ Dean Ramsey remembered. â€œAt that time, I was like, â€˜Iâ€™m going down with the car,â€™ but sheâ€™s like, â€˜Get out of this car! You got to get out! Kick your leg!â€™ I started thrashing my leg and my foot popped out.â€ The rescue took about five minutes. Back on dry land, the Ramsey family saw their rescuers as â€œguardian angels.â€ The families say they have plans to reunite in the near future. The Bell family wants to remind residents to always be mindful of their surroundings and assess a situation before getting involved. They said if your car is going in a body of water, roll down the windows or punch them out by hitting the corners. Those tactics could save a life. Copyright 2024 WXIX via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: Haika Mrema
title: â€˜Miami Viceâ€™ Don Johnson Recalls Being Famous in the â€˜80s: â€˜We Had Security 24/7â€™ | The Epoch Times
text: Actor Don Johnson recalls the overwhelming fame he experienced during his years on â€œMiami Vice.â€ [People](https://people.com/don-johnson-80s-heartthrob-was-dangerous-exclusive-8714229), Johnson shared the challenges of his widespread recognition and the measures taken to ensure his protection. â€œFor a long time, I couldnâ€™t even go anywhere,â€ Johnson said about dealing with his avid â€œMiami Viceâ€ fans. â€œI had to isolate. The [women] know where you are. We had security 24/7.â€ â€œOne day, I reflected on Elvis and thought, â€˜Isnâ€™t this kind of the way Elvis lived and died?â€™ Not that Iâ€™m comparing myself to Elvis, but in terms of him not being able to have a personal life. So I learned to manage it and vowed not to let it imprison me,â€ he said. Johnson rose to stardom in the mid-'80s playing Detective James â€œSonnyâ€ Crockett on the hit crime drama series â€œMiami Vice.â€ While he received acclaim for the role, he was worried for a time that he would be permanently typecast as the Miami detective many have come to love. â€œMy goal then was to not be Sonny Crockett forever,â€ he said. â€œI had seen the peril of the actors who were too identifiable with their character. I felt like I had to separate myself from Sonny so people could eventually see me as other characters.â€ However, he acknowledged the publicity he received from his role. â€œItâ€™s the 40th anniversary of Miami Vice this year, and hey, Iâ€™m still here,â€ he joked. Johnson is now a father of fiveâ€“his second-born is actress Dakota Johnsonâ€“and appreciates the flexibility he now has with his acting career so he can spend time with his family. â€œWork-life balance is an interesting thing as an actor because movies eat your life. Television shows eat your life,â€ he said. â€œLuckily, Iâ€™m at a place where I can pick and choose roles, and sometimes I often prefer the supporting role because I still get joy out of what I do, but I donâ€™t want to work those long hours and be away from my family.â€ These days, the â€œMiami Viceâ€ mania Johnson once experienced from fans has subsided, and he is content with where itâ€™s at today. â€œFame is a condition,â€ he said. â€œBut it also goes away.â€ Johnson recently starred in the Netflix thriller â€œRebel Ridge,â€ released Sept. 5, and is set to star in the Hulu show â€œDoctor Odysseyâ€ coming out later this month. Johnsonâ€™s CareerJohnson was born on Dec. 15, 1949, and spent his earliest days between Flat Creek, Missouri, and Wichita, Kansas. After dropping out of the University of Kansas, he moved to San Francisco and then Los Angeles, where he got his first major role in the stage production â€œFortune and Menâ€™s Eyes.â€ Some of Johnsonâ€™s first film appearances include â€œThe Magic Garden of Stanley Sweetheartâ€ (1970), â€œZachariahâ€ (1971), â€œThe Harrad Experimentâ€ (1973), and â€œA Boy and His Dogâ€ (1975). He also had minor roles in TV shows such as â€œSarge,â€ â€œKung Fu,â€ â€œThe Rookies,â€ and â€œNashville 99.â€ Johnson received his big break in 1984 when he starred as Detective James â€œSonnyâ€ Crockett in the NBC television cop series â€œMiami Vice.â€ The show ran for six seasons until 1990. Johnsonâ€™s performance on the show earned him a Golden Globe Award and an Emmy nomination. Later, Johnson starred in the CBS police drama â€œNash Bridgesâ€ alongside Cheech Marin and Jodi Lyn Oâ€™Keefe. The series lasted six seasons from 1996 to 2001. The 74-year-old actor also ventured into music, releasing two pop music albums, 1986â€™s â€œHeartbeatâ€ and 1989â€™s â€œLet it Rollâ€. His single â€œHeartbeatâ€ peaked at No. 5 on the Billboard Hot 100. Johnson was awarded a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 1996.
